main event: A civilian in Detroit, Michigan observed a bright, oblong object with a trailing white phosphorus-like glow, pink-red in the middle, and bright green in the front. The object moved across the sky at a high rate of speed, disappearing behind some trees.
interesting points: The object seemed to increase in brightness and size as it moved across the sky.
The red and green areas of the object were constant, while the white trail varied slightly in shape.
The brilliant white tail was about 1 1/2 times as long as the green and red areas.
The observer initially thought the object was a shooting star, but it gained speed and increased in brilliance.
The object disappeared behind some trees at a high rate of speed.
sighted object: a bright, oblong object with a trailing white phosphorus-like glow, pink-red in the middle, and bright green in the front
